reviewDescription: I am writing the review after 4 days use. I found it better than my expectations.It fulfills all the requirements and have all the facilities as written in specification. The look, build quality, responsiveness and accuracy is superb. GPS position and map working fine, there is no hitch in connecting GPS. BT calling is working fine. I have not charged the battery since 4 days and its still 40 % left with all the functions in use for 4 hr use daily. Cable for charging is smoothly sitting in it place for charging.Its belt is smooth but I felt skin irritation after couple of hours use and a bit difficult to take out due to its tuck in design, this is only drawback I face with this smartwatch.

reviewTitle: Watch itself is very good but the strap is not good.
reviewDescription: The watch itself is very good but as for the strap, it looks and feels good in the hand however it is not good for longer wearing. It has caused a rash. I don't wear it too tightly and my previous smartwatch's strap never had any such problems. So, I recommend buying a different strap. As for the smartwatch itself, The step counter is very accurate due to the GPS. The speaker is loud and clear enough. and the battery drops around 15% per day with every feature turned on (all day heart rate monitoring, all day SpO2 monitoring, all day stress monitoring, always on display, raise to wake up). I charge it everyday when I bath. In 20 minutes it charges 30% from my 33 Watt charger so, the battery life is very good. the companion app (mi fitness) is also very good. it makes reaching the goals like a game. If you have a hyperOS smartphone like me, it is very good as it syncs things like DND mode as well.

reviewTitle: Surprisingly Solid Budget Fitness Tracker - Redmi Watch 5 Lite Review
reviewDescription: The Redmi Watch 5 Lite punches well above its weight for the price. I was pleasantly surprised by its feature set and overall performance.Pros: * Sleek Design: The watch looks modern and minimalistic. It's lightweight and comfortable to wear all day, even during sleep. * Accurate Fitness Tracking: Steps, heart rate, and sleep monitoring seem accurate and reliable. GPS for outdoor activities works well too. * Good Battery Life: Easily lasts a week on a single charge with moderate usage, which is impressive for a budget tracker. * Decent Display: The screen is bright and clear enough for outdoor visibility. * Value for Money: You get a lot of features for the price, making it a compelling option for budget-conscious fitness enthusiasts.Cons: * Limited App Support: While the app has basic functionality, it could use some improvements in terms of UI/UX and features. * Smartwatch Features are Basic: Don't expect advanced smartwatch features like extensive app support or voice assistant integration.Overall:If you're looking for an affordable fitness tracker that delivers on the essentials, the Redmi Watch 5 Lite is an excellent choice. It's a solid all-rounder with accurate tracking, good battery life, and a stylish design. While it may lack some of the bells and whistles of more expensive smartwatches, it effectively serves its purpose as a fitness companion.Recommendation:Highly recommended for budget-conscious individuals who prioritize fitness tracking features like step counting, heart rate monitoring, and sleep tracking.Note: This review is based on personal experience and may vary depending on individual usage.I hope this review is helpful!

reviewTitle: Disappointing Experience with Several Missing Features and Bugs
reviewDescription: 1. No Auto-Lock Feature: The watch lacks an auto-lock feature, such as unlocking by holding the side button. This is problematic in situations involving water (showering, washing hands, or rain), leading to accidental touch issues.2. Missing Auto-Brightness: At this price point, an auto-brightness feature is expected. Its absence impacts battery life, as brightness cannot adjust automatically to ambient light.3. No Compass or Water Reminder: Basic features like a compass and water reminder are missing, which are typically standard in smartwatches at this price.4. Inaccurate GPS: The GPS accuracy is subpar, affecting activity tracking.5. Software Bugs:Step counter issues: After completing 3260 steps yesterday, the stats failed to reset after midnight, showing yesterday’s data incorrectly. (As you can see in the image).Sleep tracking: The watch inaccurately recorded a nap while I was awake and moving regularly.Each time you make or receive a call, the volume automatically resets to the minimum. You have to manually increase it after every call, and there is no option to permanently set it to the maximum.Additionally, Xiaomi's app only provides a basic breath quality score, whereas Amazfit offers more detailed information. In Amazfit, I found insights like how many times I experienced poor breath quality along with the specific times. Xiaomi's app needs to offer more detailed data and insights for a better user experience.6. Google Calendar Sync Limitations: The watch only syncs events from Google Calendar but does not sync tasks, limiting its productivity functionality.Given these issues, the watch does not meet expectations at this price. The software is particularly disappointing. In comparison, Amazfit provided much more accurate tracking and better app data. I used Amazfit for 2 years, but due to a display issue, I decided to buy a new one and wanted to experience the Hyper OS ecosystem. Being a Xiaomi phone user, I expected more from their smartwatch, but the experience has been underwhelming. I hope future updates address the bugs and improve feature accuracy.In Amazfit, the Zepp OS provides additional features like app installations, which add value. However, I don't see any unique features in Xiaomi's Hyper OS. It feels as simple as what you’d find in other smartwatches in the ₹1,000-₹2,000 range like Fastrack, Fire-Bolt, Noise, Boat, or similar brands. There’s nothing special or any additional features like the ones Zepp OS offers. Xiaomi's Hyper OS seems more like hype than actual innovation.It also lacks animated watch faces, which are common in other smartwatches. They really need to improve several aspects.

reviewTitle: Super awesome smartwatch for daily use
reviewDescription: My father has been using this watch for a couple of days, and as you can see in the picture it's beautifuly adopts the wrist. Have no complaints about touch response as it has the Amoled display allowing always on clock. reviewTitle: Way better than Fast-track, Bout, Bolt and other local smartwatches!
reviewDescription: This smartwatch has all the top end features and works pretty well.The main attraction is the big amoled display and the lighter weight.Only point of improvement is the software bugs and the mi fitness app. As the step count keeps increasing even when i was sleeping at night (attached image). Also after 12 am the watch doesn't reset back to zero steps and calories. Need to restart the watch.More importantly, missing the ambient auto brightness and auto lock features.Lastly, the delivery partner didn't deliver the watch safety, as the box had a hole in between (attached image).Final verdict, the best smartwatch currently with best display and features. Just some fine tuning required from software point of view.

I recommend that Redmi/Xiaomi should add more new watch faces and introduce additional features by pushing new update for this model. The only issue I faced in this model is that the speaker has low sound; it should be improved in the next version.

I bought this watch only for gps tracking of walk and running. It is doing good job of tracking even in middle of buildings. Gps tracks within seconds. Not sure how accurate it is but it looks good.Also connects well wit strava.

The things i didn't like areWatch is bulky and I want to return it for this reason.Speaker volume is not loud and it gets reset to low often.We have to uninstall a face to install a new face.Rest of the features are decent and working as expected.

If you’re looking for a reliable and feature-packed device on a budget, the Redmi Watch 5 Lite is definitely worth buying.

The Redmi Watch 5 Lite is an impressive addition to the wearable tech market, combining style, functionality, and affordability. Here's a breakdown of its standout features:Vibrant AMOLED DisplayThe display is a treat for the eyes, offering sharp visuals and bright colors that are easy to view even under sunlight. Whether you're checking your steps or reading notifications, the AMOLED screen makes everything pop.Enhanced Five-System GPSWith its multi-system GPS, this watch ensures accurate tracking for outdoor activities, making it a reliable companion for runners, cyclists, and hikers alike.5 ATM Water ResistanceWhether you're swimming or caught in the rain, the Redmi Watch 5 Lite handles it all. Its 5 ATM water resistance means you can dive up to 50 meters without worry.Up to 18 Days Battery LifeForget constant charging! The impressive battery life ensures nearly three weeks of use on a single charge, even with daily activity tracking and notifications.150+ Sports ModesFrom common workouts to niche activities, the watch supports over 150 sports modes, ensuring you can track your performance no matter what you do.200+ Watch FacesPersonalization is key, and with over 200 watch faces, you can easily switch up your style to match your mood or outfit.HyperOS ConnectivitySeamlessly connect to your Redmi devices with HyperOS, ensuring quick syncing of notifications, music, and health data.VerdictThe Redmi Watch 5 Lite is a fantastic choice for fitness enthusiasts and casual users alike. It combines premium features with a budget-friendly price, making it a standout option in its category. If you're looking for a stylish, reliable smartwatch with long battery life and advanced fitness tracking, this one's hard to beat.

I'm loving my Redmi Watch 2 Lite For the price, it's a steal. The design is sleek, the display is crisp, and the fitness features are on point. Battery life is also impressive - up to 10 days on a single charge My only gripe is that the outdoor visibility could be better. Overall, I'd highly recommend it to anyone looking for a reliable, affordable smartwatch. 4.5/5 stars

reviewTitle: Redmi watch 5 lite the perfect budget smartwatch
reviewDescription: I recently purchased the Redmi Watch 5 Lite and have been using it for about two weeks. Here are my thoughts on its features and performance:*Design and Build*The Redmi Watch 5 Lite has a sleek and modern design that looks premium. The watch is lightweight and comfortable to wear, making it perfect for daily use. The build quality is solid, and the watch feels durable.*Features*I'm impressed with the features offered by the Redmi Watch 5 Lite. It has a built-in GPS, heart rate monitor, and supports various fitness tracking modes. The watch also receives notification alerts, allows music control, and has a built-in microphone for voice assistant.*Performance*The Redmi Watch 5 Lite performs smoothly, and the touchscreen response is quick. The battery life is impressive, lasting around 10 days on a single charge. The watch also supports fast charging, which is a convenient feature.*Value for Money*Considering the features and performance, I think the Redmi Watch 5 Lite is an excellent value for money. It's an affordable smartwatch that offers a lot of functionality, making it a great option for those on a budget.Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with the Redmi Watch 5 Lite. It's a great smartwatch for fitness enthusiasts, casual users, and anyone looking for a budget-friendly option.

reviewTitle: Very good hardware and tracking, but buggy software
reviewDescription: Firstly, for the price, it is a steal. For 3300, you are getting 1.96" AMOLED, AOD display, 5 ATM, 5 satellite GPS, BT calling and accurate sensors.The good:1. GPS is accurate.2. Good number of watch faces to select3. Activity tracking has good features (Auto pause/Always ON). Fantastic!4. Good battery life5. Sensors are very good and accurate.The bad:  Software is very buggy.1. Speaker volume is default low, during calls - you have manually increase2.  After auto pause, even though it shows to be tracking activity, GPS data is not saved! The summary data is way off (calories!) and GPS data is not recorded. This is a serious bug in activity tracking. Observed this during cycling.3. For workouts menu, no provision to add/remove or reorder the workouts. This is a pain, if your workout is not listed in first page.4. Silly overlooked bugs ("customization" word is replaced with "complications" word in one of the menus).5. Strava sync does not sync Heart rate data!Like many users have reported, software is very buggy. Hope xiaomi is noting the reviews. An excellent piece of hardware. If no software updates, this is going to be ruined by buggy software
Touch is working completely fine, It looks really good in my hand. The sleep tracking is effective too.
